More Notes: Effect of each additional dry spell day >28. Conditions on drought. Direct effect.
Estimated small negative impact.  Placeholder value used; page states the effect is negative.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (1): dry spell and heat wave measures are weighted temporally using cropped area by month from MIRCA2000 to approximate growing seasons. Clustered standard errors.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (2): SPEI is quantified just prior to the first of the 90-hottest day per cell. Clustered standard errors.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (3): adjust for counts of days in 10F temperature bins in addition to average temperature. Clustered standard errors.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (4): cubic precipitation and temperature terms. Clustered standard errors.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (5): quartic precipitation and temperature terms. Clustered standard errors.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (6): linear rather than quadratic per-country trends. Clustered standard errors.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (7): cubic rather than quadratic per-country trends. Clustered standard errors.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (8): add 1-year lags of all environmental variables. Clustered standard errors.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (9): add lagged log value added per capita in agriculture, fisheries, and forestry. Clustered standard errors.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (10): same as (9) but instrument for the added term using lagged log GDP per capita. Clustered standard errors.

Estimated effect of an additional dry spell day for a minimum dry spell duration of 28 days and a minimum heat wave duration of 9 days. Model (11): use log of value added per capita in agriculture, fisheries, and forestry as an alternate outcome. Clustered standard errors.
